citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility’s Program of Veterinary Care states that the Attending Veterinarian will make scheduled visits to the premises
at least twice per year. At time of inspection, the facility did not have documentation of meeting that requirement. The
formal arrangement with an attending or consulting veterinarian shall include regularly scheduled visits to the premises, in
addition to the written program of veterinary care. Each dealer shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal
arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall
include a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor.
Correct by: 09/09/2025

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female red fox was observed with squinty only opened half way, eyes which the facility reported has been present for
approximately 7 days but had not been communicated with the attending veterinarian. The facility reported the fox has
been otherwise acting normally. All animals should be observed on a daily basis, with any problems conveyed to the
attending veterinarian in a timely manner. Failure to consult with a veterinarian and provide appropriate diagnostics and
treatment can result in a poor outcome for animals. Corrected at the time of inspection.
Correct by: 08/12/2025

Sharp points were found in the Cockatiel enclosure. There was a piece of wire hanger with exposed points. The cockatiel
was free in the enclosure with access to the sharp points. The primary enclosure must be constructed and maintained so
that they have no sharp points that could potentially injure the birds. Corrected at the time of inspection.
Correct by: 08/12/2025

A single Harris’s Hawk was observed repeatedly flying up to the upper corner of a wall of its enclosure that had been
covered in shade cloth. The attachment hardware, for the same section, had pulled apart forming a tunnel with the outer
wire. Enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the birds from injury. Corrected at the time of
inspection.
Correct by: 08/12/2024

The Chicken enclosure and the Red Tail Hawk enclosure had platform/nestbox tops with exposed damaged particleboard
that was not able to be effectively cleaned and sanitized. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that
all surfaces in contact with the birds may be readily cleaned and/or sanitized in accordance with 3.158 or be replaced
when worn or soiled.
Correct by: 08/20/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility’s Program of Veterinary Care states that the Attending Veterinarian will make scheduled visits to the premises 
at least twice per year. At time of inspection, the facility did not have documentation of meeting that requirement. The 
formal arrangement with an attending or consulting veterinarian shall include regularly scheduled visits to the premises, in 
addition to the written program of veterinary care. Each dealer shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal 
arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall 
include a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor.  
Correct by: 09/09/2025 
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female red fox was observed with squinty only opened half way, eyes which the facility reported has been present for 
approximately 7 days but had not been communicated with the attending veterinarian. The facility reported the fox has 
been otherwise acting normally. All animals should be observed on a daily basis, with any problems conveyed to the 
attending veterinarian in a timely manner. Failure to consult with a veterinarian and provide appropriate diagnostics and 
treatment can result in a poor outcome for animals. Corrected at the time of inspection. 
Correct by: 08/12/2025 
3.153(a)(1)(i)  Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
Sharp points were found in the Cockatiel enclosure. There was a piece of wire hanger with exposed points. The cockatiel 
was free in the enclosure with access to the sharp points. The primary enclosure must be constructed and maintained so 
that they have no sharp points that could potentially injure the birds. Corrected at the time of inspection. 
Correct by: 08/12/2025 
3.153(a)(1)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures.

A single Harris’s Hawk was observed repeatedly flying up to the upper corner of a wall of its enclosure that had been 
covered in shade cloth. The attachment hardware, for the same section, had pulled apart forming a tunnel with the outer 
wire. Enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they protect the birds from injury. Corrected at the time of 
inspection. 
Correct by: 08/12/2024 
3.153(a)(1)(ix) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The Chicken enclosure and the Red Tail Hawk enclosure had platform/nestbox tops with exposed damaged particleboard 
that was not able to be effectively cleaned and sanitized. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that 
all surfaces in contact with the birds may be readily cleaned and/or sanitized in accordance with 3.158 or be replaced 
when worn or soiled. 
Correct by: 08/20/2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
